SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Conductor failure manifests by high lead impedance either absolutely (above manufacturer's product specifications) or by a significant increase from previously stable chronic values.
The cardiac lead is not performing as expected with issues such as oversensing with or without shock or ATP, or failed shocks or inadequate DFT safety margins defibrillation activity.
This manifests as stimulation by the lead of non-cardiac structures such as the diaphragm, chest wall, or pectoral muscle.
The cardiac lead failed to administer a shock and had an inadequate defibrillator threshold safety margin.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: FAILED TO SHOCK WITH INADEQUATE DFT SAFETY MARGIN
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Failure to Shock with Inadequate Defibrillator Threshold Safety Margin

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Failure to capture manifests as a high pacing threshold that results in either intermittent failure to capture at maximal programmed output or excessive battery drain leading to premature battery exhaustion.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: FAILURE TO CAPTURE WITH ACCEPTABLE SAFETY MARGIN
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Failure to Capture with Acceptable Safety Margin

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Failure to pace manifests as absence of pacemaker stimulation artifacts on electrocardiographic recordings despite rates below pacemaker programmed rate.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Failure of Cardiac Pacemaker to Pace

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Insulation failure manifests as low lead impedance either absolutely (below manufacturer's product specifications) or by a significant decrease from previously stable chronic values.
The movement (macroscopic or microscopic) of an existing lead within the heart or vascular tree away from the original implantation site.
This manifests as sensing of non-cardiac depolarization signals that met arrhythmia detection criteria and elicited programmed tachyarrhythmia therapy.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Cardiac Device Oversensing with Shock or Anti-Tachycardia Pacing

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: This manifests as sensing of non-cardiac depolarization signals that did not meet arrhythmia detection criteria and do not elicit programmed tachyarrhythmia therapy.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Cardiac Device Oversensing without Shock or Anti-Tachycardia Pacing

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: Oversensing manifests as sensing of electrical signals not related to cardiac depolarization of the lead chamber that cannot be resolved acceptably by device reprogramming.
The pacing and/or sensing problem associated with high impedance due to a poor connection between a lead and generator caused by a loose set screw.
Undersensing manifests as failure to sense appropriate cardiac depolarizations that cannot be resolved with reprogramming.
